variants.Description in input context: A53T mutation in alpha-synuclein (SNCA) associated with familial Parkinson's disease

Material used.Material Name: Patient-derived brain samples with A53T mutation
Material used.Description: Brain tissues from patients with the A53T mutation in SNCA were analyzed for alpha-synuclein and tau pathology.

Readout description.Molecular Effect: Increased aggregation of alpha-synuclein and tau
Readout description.Result Description: Immunohistochemical staining revealed abnormal accumulation of phosphorylated alpha-synuclein and tau in brain regions affected by Parkinson's disease.

Biological replicates.Description: Not explicitly mentioned in the abstract.

Technical replicates.Description: Not explicitly mentioned in the abstract.

Basic positive control.Description: Not explicitly mentioned in the abstract.

Basic negative control.Description: Not explicitly mentioned in the abstract.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Normal staining patterns with no significant aggregation

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Presence of phosphorylated alpha-synuclein and tau inclusions

Material used.Material Name: Brain tissue homogenates from A53T mutation carriers
Material used.Description: Biochemical assays were performed to quantify nitrated alpha-synuclein and tau levels in brain extracts.

Readout description.Result Description: Biochemical analysis demonstrated elevated levels of nitrated alpha-synuclein in brain extracts from A53T mutation carriers.

Biological replicates.Description: Not explicitly mentioned in the abstract.

Basic negative control.Description: Not explicitly mentioned in the abstract.

Material used.Material Name: Ultra-thin sections of brain tissue from A53T mutation carriers
Material used.Description: Electron microscopy was used to visualize ultrastructural changes in alpha-synuclein and tau aggregates.

Readout description.Result Description: Ultrastructural analysis revealed filamentous inclusions composed of alpha-synuclein and tau in brain regions affected by the A53T mutation.

Material used.Material Name: Recombinant alpha-synuclein and tau proteins with A53T mutation
Material used.Description: In vitro experiments were conducted to study the effects of the A53T mutation on alpha-synuclein and tau fibrillization.

Readout description.Molecular Effect: Accelerated fibrillization of alpha-synuclein and tau
Readout description.Result Description: In vitro fibrillization assays demonstrated that the A53T mutation in alpha-synuclein significantly accelerated the formation of fibrils, which were further stabilized by tau.
